website_summaries.verdict: Stylish yet highly functional with a simple design that's incredibly user-friendly.
pros: Stands out for its functionality and durable construction
The magnetic latch doors allow you to tend your fire without needing to move the whole screen
It comes in two sizes to fit flush to your fireplace
The heavy duty mesh is of a quality build
cons: Shipping packaging not up to scratch—some users report damage in transit

customer_reviews.title: Seamless fit!
customer_reviews.text: I have ferrets that won't stay out of the fireplace. In the past, I've just blocked the wood-burning fireplace with cardboard and put the TV in front of it, but moving into my new house, with a beautiful gas fireplace, I didn't want to hide it. This screen is extremely heavy. Despite their neverending attempts, my little catsnakes have been unsuccessful at opening the doors or tipping the screen. Personally, I wouldn't trust this to withstand small children without some kind of mounting or heavy-duty adhesive, but it's great for keeping your furbabies safe.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Redden

customer_reviews.title: for the money this works pretty darn well
customer_reviews.text: for the money this works pretty darn well. the only negative is how it grips the inside of the fireplace. we ended up anchoring points inside and screwing it into our fireplace to make it more sturdy. we ended up NOT using the L shaped brackets in front because they don't look as nice with them and were a tripping hazard (have a toddler).
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles-Desmo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome screen for the hearth
customer_reviews.text: We have a rather flat hearth front, and a cat that loves to hide in the flu. Toss in the odd small child wandering about, and it all means that the hearth needs something stout on it. This is a gorgeous piece or work that installed in minutes, with the 'feet' being adjustable so we could get it nice and ight against the entrance of the fireplace. The glass panels throw some light, and the mesh allows for easy air/heat transfer. The shipping box is sturdy and it arrived with no damage to the contents.

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable, but cheap and ugly
customer_reviews.text: A classic case of you get what you pay for. You can see the clumsy welding marks on the front and the thing is just embarrassing to present to guests. My guess is that if you have a really nice façade to your fireplace, say high quality stone, then this might work. But if that's the case you can probably afford a properly made screen and aren't looking to get it cheap on Amazon. Also, the door handles of course get very hot. Caution to parents of little ones. Overall it's not horrible and it was a breeze to assemble.

We bought this to keep our new kittens out of the fireplace. They were ready to jump into the fire out of curiosity. We had to watch them constantly. This solved the problem. It is very sturdy and beautiful. The bonus was how beautiful it is with a fire. I love the look of it.

customer_reviews.title: Tempered glass prevents the flow of heat from the fire place
customer_reviews.text: Everything is OK for this screen, but the tempered glass on top of the screen prevents the flow of the heat. The screen looks good too, but with this minor design flow. I have to pull back the screen about 3 inches away from my fireplace for the heat to flow correctly. I thought the tempered glass is pretty, but it actually not noticeable at all. I would buy one without no tempered glass.
